title: Keen combo cd cover I made
content:

EDIT: SCROLL DOWN PAGE FOR THE PICTURES!
Note: These need a little bit of resizing before you print them!

title: Re: Keen combo cd cover I made
content:
BITMAPS?!

BITMAPS?!

I doubt those are over 256 colors. You could have easily gone with GIF. Hell, just a PNG would suffice and there'd be no color loss. Learn image compression.-----
[img]http://gnosticus.spatang.com/PBF056BCPuppyWish.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Keen combo cd cover I made
content:
You could have posted them at full size as pngs and they would have been smaller than that! I gave up waiting for them to load, and I'm on a DSL connection!________________

title: Re: Keen combo cd cover I made
content:
The combo cd which I purchased from the 3drealms site does indeed have printing on the cd.
At the top of the disc is the COMMANDER KEEN logo with invasion of the vorticons and Goodbye, Galaxy written underneath in smaller white writting, then on the left side in the middle is the id and apogee logos then on the left side is the picture of the dopefish sprite used in keen4 all printed on a black background!

to everyone else: yes I know little about image compression (I know jpg is smaller than bmp and that bmp has no loss in image quality) and I will read up on these other formats which have been suggested and try and make one with it. Also I would like to say that it might still take a while as it is hosted on freewebs.com
-later.

title: Re: Keen combo cd cover I made
content:
Try .PNG format; bitmap quality, no loss and smaller size. [Windows automatically compresses it as much as possible, however, some extra compression, especially with 16 color bitmaps, if you use PNGout.]A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

-Levellord

title: how about a fangame combo cd?
content: someone who has a better internet connection than I (i have dialup[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:"> ) should compile a cd with all the good mods and fangames.  that would be awesome bcuz i can't download anything over 2 or 3 mgs cuz it takes a lifetime and i get bumped every time.  a fangame cd would be sweeeet[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

title: GetRight.
content:
Try [url=http://getright.com/get.html]GetRight[/url]... it allows you to pause downloads if necessary and resume them when they cut out (there are some sites this feature doesn't work for, but you shouldn't have any trouble with Keen mods from Spatang and KeenGrid).Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: GetRight.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The rest are perfect![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 9/10[hr][/quote]Well, except for the fact that "prompt" is misspelled [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Oh, and you should stick to one spelling of either "disk" or "disc." Usually "disc" refers to a CD (given that a disc is a round object) whereas "disk" refers to floppies and hard drives, since they're usually not round until you start looking inside them...

title: Re: GetRight.
content:
After thinking for a bit, I figured my on-the-fly theories were all flawed, so I looked it up:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disk]en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disk[/url] seems to have the correct information.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: That that that
content:
I was thinking something similar originally, for a minute thought "disk" was short for "diskette", until I realised the rest of word is "-ette" and right after that that that is of course a suffix, and had a good laugh at my own expense. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Cool, I made a "that that that" sentence!

title: Re: That that that
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]Cool, I made a "that that that" sentence![hr][/quote]And boy, was it crying out for a comma... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: That that that
content: The text in which I misspelled "prompt" and "Disc" was copied from a commander keen booklet that came from the original floppy DISK version of the game, so that explains my mistake of disK from disC.  Not sure how I missed that prompt one though.
